intro: Elaphoglossum christophersenii, commonly known as the Christophersen’s holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Dryopteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically divided into smaller, pointed segments. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called sori, which are clustered on the underside of the fronds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate forest regions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant component of its native habitat.
